subject: Relationships
title: Friendship Apps: Can Technology Fix Loneliness?
description: A fast breakdown of Friendship Apps: Can Technology Fix Loneliness? for builders.

hook.text: Bumble BFF, Meetup, Friender ‚Äî apps for finding friends now outnumber apps for finding dates.

buildup.text: Friendship apps use the same algorithms as dating apps: match by interests, proximity, and demographics.

discovery.text: Early data shows friendship apps increase social contact ‚Äî but most matches don't convert to lasting bonds.

twist.text: The bottleneck isn't finding people. It's investing 200 hours afterward. Apps start the journey, not finish it.

climax.text: Technology can introduce you. But it can't make you show up, be vulnerable, or keep texting back.

punchline.text: Apps can introduce friends. Only time and effort can keep them.

quiz.question: What is the main limitation of friendship apps?
options: Matches rarely convert to lasting bonds without time investment
